name: Kasper Schmeichel
desc: Provided leadership and composure from the back, recording 15 clean sheets and organizing a defense that conceded only 36 goals

name: Danny Simpson
desc: Replaced the more attacking Ritchie De Laet and brought defensive stability, maintaining discipline and rarely venturing forward

name: Wes Morgan (C)
desc: Team captain who led by example with his strong defensive performances, aerial ability, and crucial goal contributions during set-pieces

name: Robert Huth
desc: Experienced center-back who formed a solid partnership with Wes Morgan, known for his physical presence and ability to read the game

name: Christian Fuchs
desc: Provided width and attacking support from the left-back position, contributing with assists and maintaining defensive duties effectively

name: Riyad Mahrez
desc: The Algerian winger’s 17 goals and 11 assists earned him PFA Player of the Year, dazzling defenders with flair and composure

name: Danny Drinkwater
desc: Key figure in midfield, known for his passing range and ability to break up opposition play, contributing significantly to Leicester's control in games

name: N'Golo Kanté
desc: The little-known French midfielder was a revelation in central midfield, leading the league in tackles and interceptions

name: Marc Albrighton
desc: Worked tirelessly on the flank, stretching play wide and delivering accurate crosses that fueled Leicester’s swift breaks

name: Shinji Okazaki
desc: His relentless pressing and selfless runs opened space for Vardy, epitomizing the team’s energy and discipline

name: Jamie Vardy
desc: Scored 24 league goals, including a record run of goals in 11 straight matches, spearheading Leicester’s ruthless counterattack
